    Are the following disclosed:
<ul>
    <li>The nature and amounts of government grants recognised in the financial statements;</li>
    <li>Unfulfilled conditions and other contingencies attaching to government grants that have been recognised in income;</li>
    <li>An indication of other forms of government assistance from which the entity has directly benefited?</li>
</ul>
<p>This disclosure does not apply to benefits that that arise in determining the amount of tax such as R&D tax credits etc.</p>
<p>Examples would include free technical or marketing advice, the provision of guarantees and loans at nil or low interest rates.</p>

    question => string (898) "Where, in determining the carrying amount of assets and liabilities there ar...
    $value[8]['question']
    Where, in determining the carrying amount of assets and liabilities there are material uncertainties, are the following disclosed:
<ul>
    <li>The nature of the uncertainties;</li>
    <li>The carrying amount as at the end of the reporting period?</li>
</ul>
<p>Typical disclosures would include:</p>
<ul>
    <li>The nature of the assumptions or other estimation uncertainty;</li>
    <li>The sensitivity of carrying amounts to the methods, assumptions and estimates underlying their calculation, including the reasons for the sensitivity;</li>
    <li>The expected resolution of an uncertainty and the range of possible outcomes within the next financial year in respect of the carrying amounts of the assets and liabilities; and</li>
    <li>An explanation of changes made to past assumptions concerning those assets and liabilities, if the uncertainty remains unresolved.</li>
</ul>

    question => string (1825) "Have amounts incurred by the entity for the provision of key management serv...
    $value[37]['question']
    Have amounts incurred by the entity for the provision of key management services that are provided by a separate management entity been separately disclosed?
<p>Unless separate disclosure is needed to understand the effects of related party transactions, transactions which are similar in nature can be aggregated where they relate to similar related parties.</p>
<p>IAS 24 requires separate disclosure for each of the following categories of related party, has this disclosure been given:</p>
<ul>
    <li>The parent;</li>
    <li>Entities with joint control or significant influence over the entity;</li>
    <li>Subsidiaries;</li>
    <li>Associates;</li>
    <li>Joint ventures in which the entity is a joint venturer;</li>
    <li>Key management personnel of the entity or its parent; and</li>
    <li>Other related parties?</li>
</ul>
<p>NB: Regarding similar transactions, IAS 24 gives the following examples where aggregation could occur:</p>
<ul>
    <li>Purchases or sales of goods (finished or unfinished); </li>
    <li>Purchases or sales of property and other assets;</li>
    <li>Rendering or receiving services;</li>
    <li>Leases;</li>
    <li>Transfers of R&D;</li>
    <li>Transfers under licence agreements;</li>
    <li>Transfers under finance agreements (including loans and equity contributions in the form of cash or in kind);</li>
    <li>Provision of guarantees or collateral;</li>
    <li>Commitments to do something if a particular event occurs or does not occur in the future, including executory contracts (recognised and unrecognised);</li>
    <li>Settlement of liabilities on behalf of the entity or on behalf of another party; and</li>
    <li>Participation by a parent or subsidiary in a defined benefit plan where risks are shared between group entities</li>
</ul>

    Has adequate disclosure been given to allow an evaluation of the entity’s objectives, policies and processes for managing capital?
<p>To comply with IAS 1, paragraph 134, the following disclosures should be given:</p>
<ol type="a">
    <li>A description of what the entity manages as capital;</li>
    <li>When an entity is subject to externally imposed capital requirements, the nature of those requirements and how those requirements are incorporated into the management of capital;</li>
    <li>How it is meeting its objectives for managing capital;</li>
    <li>Summary quantitative data about what it manages as capital;</li>
    <li>Any changes in (a) to (d) from the previous period;</li>
    <li>Whether, during the period, externally imposed capital requirements were complied with and where not, the consequences of such non-compliance.</li>
</ol>
<p>NB: These disclosures should be based on the information provided internally to key management personnel</p>
<p>NB: Where an entity has a number of different ways of measuring capital or is subject to a number of different external capital requirement, information may only be given on an aggregate basis if it would still be meaningful.</p>
